TextBlock.Text: BOBER: We have just arrived on Cludos' version. There is water everywhere, but we found the engraving.
BILLY: Once again, it continues the coordinate we saw earlier, again. It goes from the top left to the bottom right.

BOBER: Above it is an engraving that looks much different, and we can't seem so understand it. The picture is of a large star, a ringed planet with a terrestrial moon, a planet with repeated symbols that has a gas moon, and a planet made of sand and water with two moons. That final planet is circled.
KATHERYNE: None of those planets exist within this system.
BILLY: Hear me out, what if this is another star system? I feel like I've seen those planets before... but I don't recall where. Launch a probe up, and set the camera to target the largest star.
BOBER: Update, it's been a few minutes, and we found the system the planet is in. The planet of interest is located in a system with a red star, so we'll have to go interstellar.
BILLY: We'll go to that red system. We'll also construct black holes around Blue to warp to and from each system. That will make travel easier.
KATHERYNE: Great idea! Let's go to the red system! Oh, and remember the planet we're looking for has two moons with sand and water flowing into it.
